Class PullCLI: used to pull remote copy of ansible on each managed node, each set to run via cron and update playbook source via a source repository. Inverts default push architecture to pull architecture, scaling. CLI tools not designed to run concurrently; need external scheduler/locking. Setup playbook can be tuned to change cron frequency, logging locations, parameters to ansible-pull. Useful for extreme scale-out and periodic remediation. Use fetch module to retrieve logs.

Thus summary: class provides command-line interface to configure and execute ansible-pull on managed nodes, handling argument parsing, playbook selection, execution, and post-processing, enabling pull-based automation with cron scheduling.

Business intent: enable large-scale, automated configuration management by converting ansible to pull model, allowing nodes to self-update from a central repository, supporting scheduling, logging, and remote log collection.

Keywords: ansible-pull, pull architecture, automation, configuration management, scaling, cron scheduling, remote execution, playbook selection, argument parsing, logging, concurrency control, remote log retrieval.
